notesStmt.note: Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: A commentary on the Pentateuch of Meyuḥas ben Eliyah.

collation.p: 13 quires of 20 leaves each, apart from the last which has only 17 leaves. Each verso had been signed but the margins were cut off.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Oriental (Byzantine) semi-cursive script, unpunctuated. Eliyahu ben Elḳanah of Nikopolis: inscribed in the colophon, folio 257v.

history.provenance: Acquisition: M. Netter: purchased from him on 14 October 1854, inscribed (folio [258v]).
